name: Northcote Manor Country House Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two couples stayed for one night on a Travelzoo offer in June 2013.
reviews.title: Absolutely Superb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is set in delightful and extensive grounds (sadly, the weather was too awful to appreciate these fully while we were there), and the building itself is maintained to a very high standard, with beautiful public rooms.
reviews.title: Amazing romantic break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid £40 extra to upgrade to a suite, and although the term 'suite' was slightly misleading ('suite' implies separate bedroom and lounge), the room was spacious and beautifully decorated, with a fabulous view over the gardens.
reviews.title: Wonderful visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff were all charming and extremely helpful, and service could not be faulted.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had the six course tasting menu with matched wines for dinner, which again was absolutely excellent. The ambience in the dining room was great, too. Breakfast was very good, too.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were really looking forward to this stay as it was a 25th wedding anniversary present from friends. Hotel is situated in a lovely countryside area. Impressive building with lots of history. All the staff were very helpful and knowledgeable. Room on first impression seemed pleasantly furnished. The food and service and ambience was excellent. The beef was very tender and the gourmet menu was well prepared. We enjoyed the wines that came with it. The staff had placed sparkly stars on our table which was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Lovely setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013
reviews.text: The downside of the room was it was hot, stuffy and dark. There was a constant humming noise and every couple of minutes it sounded as if a spin drier was operating. We put this down to the usual daily workings of a hotel. However on returning to the room after dinner the noise still persisted. We did call reception who sent someone up. He thought it may be the fan in the downstairs toilets so said he would turn it off. He did not return to see if the noise had gone. It clearly wasn't this but by this time it was too late to start packing and moving rooms. Therefore had an awful nights sleep with both the noise and heat. In hindsight we should have moved rooms but after a long journey and a few glasses of wine with dinner thought sleep would come easily. We did complain on checkout and the manager was very apologetic. He said the room was above the boiler and he would look into it. He also refunded our drinks bill.
reviews.title: If you pay the rack rate you will pay too much

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we had a very enjoyable stay. Most of the staff were extremely helpful. The food, whilst good, was certainly not what I would describe as gourmet, it lacked depth of flavour and there was very little evidence of seasoning, certainly not worth the full price of £80 if you paid it. The wines which accompanied the courses were not good quality and Cotes de Ventoux is not a Northern French wine! We lived in France for 18 months and have eaten much better for much less. Rooms (suite) very good, bed extremely comfortable, jacuzzi bath a real treat. Setting is beautiful, on the deal, including the gourmet dinner with wine, just about value at £189.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a one night stay here, using a voucher which entitled us to bed, breakfast and a gourmet dinner. What a fantastic place, from the moment you arrive, you are met by courteous, polite staff. The food was tremendous. I am quite a fussy eater, but the chef prepared a alternative menu for me, which was excellent, my husband enjoyed the normal menu, he said the steak was the best he has ever had and the wine that was served with three of the six courses, really complimented the food. Breakfast, too was wonderful, the quality of food is excellent as was the service. We had a turndown service, whilst we were at dinner, fruit and shortbread in the room. ( the shortbread was exquisite!) Lovely L'occitane and Soames Gilchrist toiletries in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Had a wonderful night's stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only a couple of drawbacks, our room was really hot all night, even with the fans on and we could not get wi fi in our room! But this is totally insignificant when you receive such fantastic food,drink and service.
reviews.title: Hidden gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights after getting a very good deal from Travelzoo. The room was lovely overlooking the front area. We had the gourmet menu which included wine and was cooked to perfection. One thing I should mention is the service. Nothing was too much trouble for any member of staff. A particular mention should go to the chap who is from Slovakia (John?). He couldn't do enough for you and was very friendly too.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having previously been impressed by a 'gourmet menu' overnight stay we decided to repeat the experience.
reviews.title: Excellent stay. Good accommodation, great staff, superb food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This time round we booked a standard room rather than a suite, and to be honest considering facilities and view felt it to be of a higher standard, accepting the room itself was smaller.
reviews.title: A treat not to be missed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Menu for the evening was a delight, each course excellent or better, and wines very well matched.
reviews.title: Top marks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: Similarly the breakfast was very good, full of flavour, and wonderfully presented which is something often overlooked for breakfasts,
reviews.title: Beautiful, tranquil, excellent staff and service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three nights at Northcote Manor and had a lovely relaxing break. The location is beautiful and secluded, the only noise coming from the sheep! We were welcomed by a member of the team and shown around the hotel, which was a nice touch. Our suite was spotless with an excellent view and very comfortable bed. We ate in the hotels restaurant on two of the nights and found the food tasty and the service of a high standard. The afternoon tea should also be sampled as this was excellent!! On one night we ate in The Portsmouth Arms pub which is at the bottom of the long driveway leading to the hotel, the landlord was friendly and we had a good pub meal. My husband and I have stayed in a number of hotels and have to say that the service at Northcote Manor was consistently professional, unobtrusive and friendly. Can't wait to come back! - Mr&Mrs Walch-Hewitt
reviews.title: Great relaxing break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We recently got married at the Northcote Manor Hotel and it was a wonderful day. We were so well looked after by the staff, the food was gorgeous and everyone was relaxed and enjoyed their stay.We booked the entire hotel for our family and friends and they all loved the high standard of the accomodation and the meals. If you are looking for a venue for a wedding,look no further!
reviews.title: A wonderful place to have a wedding!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at Northcote Manor. The bedroom was very comfortable, beautifully furnished & had lots of little extras. The gardens are beautifully kept & well worth a walk round. Best of all was a superb Gourmet Black Tie Evening with a very interesting guest speaker, lots of great wines to try & some of the best food we had eaten for a long time. Well done everyone !
reviews.title: Super Gourmet Taster Evening

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a fabulous weekend at Northcote Manor. The room was fantastic, every little detail had been thought of. The food was exceptional, wonderfully presented with fantastic flavours. The staff were attentive, efficient and very friendly. Northcote Manor is up there with best hotels we have stayed in and we cannot wait to return.
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel for the 6 course taster menu with wines. Not only did the food live up to my expectations (including the wonderful choice for breakfast) but the hotel and staff were just delightful too. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff who were determined that each guest was made to feel special. The Northcote Suite had everything we needed from tea, coffee and biscuits to bathrobes and an iron. This is a perfect retreat away from it all and I look forward to returning.
reviews.title: Perfect retreat away from it all

description: 3 AA red starts, 2 AA Rosettes, AA notable wine list and 'Devon Venue' in the Westcountry Wedding Awards. Northcote manor is a cherished Country House Hotel set in the foothills of Exmoor National Park, Enjoy sweeping views over the Taw Valley, sundowners on the sun terrace and cream teas on the lawn or in front of crackling log fires. The perfect wedding venue or conference.
